p: In particular, the adsorption efficiencies of benzene and toluene using CK and CKN materials, were greater than 90%, while their capacity to adsorb phenol was less than 70%; these results can be explained by considering the difference in polarity between the adsorbates. The capacity of P. stutzeri to metabolize aromatic hydrocarbons is as follows: benzene > toluene > phenol. P. stutzeriâ€™s ability to consume phenol from a simulated medium was almost nonexistent.
